nodes.bodyText: This endpoint needs to be the real one from local store that was created in previous article.

I believe this can be google cloud storage or any other cloud storage as well. Probably having a generic name as 'cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint' and then providing explicit s3 or azure or gc example should help.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,7 +30,7 @@ Similar to the [Inference API](inference_api.md), the Management API provides a
 * response_timeout - If the model's backend worker doesn't respond with inference response within this timeout period, the worker will be deemed unresponsive and rebooted. The units is seconds. The default value is 120 seconds.
 
 ```bash
-curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_or_azureblob_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

@@ -30,7 +30,7 @@ Similar to the [Inference API](inference_api.md), the Management API provides a
 * response_timeout - If the model's backend worker doesn't respond with inference response within this timeout period, the worker will be deemed unresponsive and rebooted. The units is seconds. The default value is 120 seconds.
 
 ```bash
-curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_or_azureblob_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,7 +43,7 @@ you can choose between synchronous or asynchronous call to make sure initial wor
 The asynchronous call returns with HTTP code 202 before trying to create workers.
 
 ```bash
-curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=false&url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=false&url=https://<cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

@@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=fals
 The synchronous call returns with HTTP code 200 after all workers have been adjusted.
 
 ```bash
-curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=true&url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=true&url=https://<cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

nodes.bodyText: @gunandrose4u This needs to be a working url for the documentation example. We can consider adding .mar file to github
The link @gunandrose4u has removed is incorrect hence suggestions is to add links from this https://github.com/pytorch/serve/blob/master/docs/model_zoo.md
Replace cloud_OR_noncloud_storage with link for squeezenet found here https://github.com/pytorch/serve/blob/master/docs/model_zoo.md
